channel.title: Like Button
channel.description: Moparscape should have a like button.. I see a lot of funny comments I want to like but I remember I can't because I'm not on FB :P. Like buttons could be really useful, letting people know you like their comment. If Moparscape ever does get like buttons, be sure to come back and like this topic!

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

This has been proposed before and I’m pretty sure it won’t happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Vexillum, post:20, topic:407892”]I don’t get what the real problem would be… Rather than spam the topic arguing with someone why not keep it simple and just like/dislike it?[/quote]If the only thing you have to say is that you like/dislike something, your reasons probably aren’t that good anyway and your opinion would be pointles

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

buut15:

Are you talking about something like this? I wouldn’t mind it.

I actually like this mod. Just don’t count likes in the users profile. I mean why not? This would not be a useless system like the reputation system, because it isn’t displayed anywhere besides on the post. I haven’t really looked into the mod in-depth, but it seems that it just displays how many people like/dislike that post without the user’s names that liked/disliked it.

It would also just be an optional thing. If you don’t want to use the like/dislike mod, then just don’t use it. I would definitely use it, because I feel sometimes that there is a time to thank, or like, a certain post. For example, when a user corrects another user spouting bullshit, I would like that post.

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:36, topic:407892”][quote author=orcashark link=topic=509178.msg3694303#msg3694303 date=1312329947]

inb4people post stupid tutorials and get liked on those posts

Yeah thats exactly whatl happen.

Well i think itl be good, and liked topics would go to the top of the post.

This obviously cant be used for JUST funny posts…

Example, Someone posts a server with a RAT on it, and he made it super undetectable, but one person finds it and posts it, but its on page 17 and there at page 20. People would like it and it would go to the top making important comments more useful.
[/quote]
Which would make it harder for people to report. Also, if someone’s going to go through all that effort to make a super-virus, they’d probably just make some program to constantly register accounts and vote up their topic.[/quote]

This is true. But overall, I think the like/dislikes would help. But liking topics to make them go to the top, this should only happen with the posts because if someone needs help or something, if they just posted it no one will see it because other topics were voted to the top.

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“orcashark, post:33, topic:407892”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=509178.msg3694292#msg3694292 date=1312329448]
inb4people post stupid tutorials and get liked on those posts
[/quote]

Yeah thats exactly whatl happen.

Well i think itl be good, and liked topics would go to the top of the post.

This obviously cant be used for JUST funny posts…

Example, Someone posts a server with a RAT on it, and he made it super undetectable, but one person finds it and posts it, but its on page 17 and there at page 20. People would like it and it would go to the top making important comments more useful.[/quote]
Which would make it harder for people to report. Also, if someone’s going to go through all that effort to make a super-virus, they’d probably just make some program to constantly register accounts and vote up their topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:27, topic:407892”][quote author=Vexillum link=topic=509178.msg3694230#msg3694230 date=1312326142]

This isn’t Facebook.

I realize that… I’m just trying to make a suggestion to make the community better, It’s just a suggestion… If it isn’t going to happen, it isn’t.
[/quote]How would it make it better?

AMG I LIEKD YUR POST SOo MCHZ BEETER[/quote]

Well, the like button would sort of help the community because if you like someones post or topic, you can like it instead of rep++ to show them that you agree with them or like it. For the dislike, if a topic gets disliked too much then instead of moderators clicking every post, they can look at the dislikes and if there is a lot of dislikes, it could be just one of those retards spamming the forum.

[quote=“orcashark, post:33, topic:407892”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=509178.msg3694292#msg3694292 date=1312329448]
inb4people post stupid tutorials and get liked on those posts
[/quote]

Yeah thats exactly whatl happen.

Well i think itl be good, and liked topics would go to the top of the post.

This obviously cant be used for JUST funny posts…

Example, Someone posts a server with a RAT on it, and he made it super undetectable, but one person finds it and posts it, but its on page 17 and there at page 20. People would like it and it would go to the top making important comments more useful.[/quote]

Yes! That would be a one of the good things like/dislikes can help the community with. And it won’t be JUST for funny posts, you can like it if you agree with it, or think its cool, or just like it

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:21, topic:407892”][quote author=Vexillum link=topic=509178.msg3694185#msg3694185 date=1312323259]
I don’t get what the real problem would be… Rather than spam the topic arguing with someone why not keep it simple and just like/dislike it?
[/quote]

Rep can be used in the same way, why not use that pointless system instead of having another pointless system?[/quote]

You can’t just rep++ someone just cause you like their comment, people shouldn’t reach 200 rep for making funny comments. That’s why there should be a like button, so you can like it simply because you like what they said, rather than rep++ them.

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

It’s a pointless feature. It encourages spam/flame from other members as a means of popularity, would only be appropriate in places where the rules are a bit more lax. To be fair, rep isn’t that much better either, as it’s hardly checked for validity unless flagged, given the amount done per day.

Read full topic

item.title: Like Button
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:15, topic:407892”][quote author=Vexillum link=topic=509178.msg3694041#msg3694041 date=1312317489]
It could be used to like a comment because you agree with it, or support it.
[/quote]

Why not post you agree with it or support it then?

It just doesn’t seem to have a point which makes it worth adding.[/quote]

It just seems a like button/dislike button would be useful here, because you can just read the comment and it will say something like dislikes(#) or likes(#) rather than having to read all the comments seeing who agrees with it… It just seems like it would be simpler.

Read full topic
